may already be available at the appropriate learning level,or the trainer may have to develop new materials.
Examples of written materials:
• Equipment instructions
• Check-lists for decision-making skills• Examples of blank charts for record-keeping• Lists of contraindications for contraceptives
Consider the following when developing and using written
materials:
•They should only contain the facts that participants
need to know.
•They should be clear.
